text: Terrence O. Callier, known as Terry Callier (May 24, 1945 - October 28, 2012) was an American jazz, soul and folk guitarist and singer-songwriter. Callier was born in the North Side of Chicago, Illinois, on May 24, 1945, and was raised in Cabrini-Green, a Chicago neighborhood. He performered songs such as "Occasional Rain" (1972), "What Color Is Love" (1973), and "I Just Can't Help Myself" (1974). He also played with George Benson, Gil Scott-Heron and others. He signed a contract with Elektra Records, releasing the albums Fire On Ice (1977) and Turn You to Love (1978). Callier died in Chicago on October 28, 2012 from cancer, aged 67. ==References== ==Other websites== * Official site * Category:1945 births Category:2012 deaths Category:Cancer deaths in Chicago Category:American guitarists Category:American singer-songwriters Category:American folk musicians Category:American jazz musicians Category:American soul musicians Category:Musicians from Chicago Category:Singer-songwriters from Chicago
